text: Lately adding new packages is taking a long time, specially the part of downloading artifacts. For example, doing Pkg.add("Plots") is taking over 90 minutes now. Is there something I can do to avoid this?

elements.text: Lately adding new packages is taking a long time, specially the part of downloading artifacts. For example, doing Pkg.add("Plots") is taking over 90 minutes now. Is there something I can do to avoid this?

text: Are you using windows? Windows was really slow on me with its registry updates.

elements.text: Are you using windows? Windows was really slow on me with its registry updates.

text:
Im using Julia on WSL2, I stopped bothering with using it on widows after the exact same problem.

Also protip if you are going to use it on WSL2 you might wanna start with version 1.6. Its in beta but has such a quality of life improvement over previous versions when it comes to package downloads and their initial compilations.

elements.text:

Also protip if you are going to use it on WSL2 you might wanna start with version 1.6. Its in beta but has such a quality of life improvement over previous versions when it comes to package downloads and their initial compilations.

text:
I installed WSL2 and I'm not sure how to learn to use it with Julia. I might end up trying to switch to Linux entirely (been thinking about it for a while). Anyway, that's a bummer, hopefully these issues can be fixed.

Thanks for the quick answer! :blush:

elements.text:
I installed WSL2 and I'm not sure how to learn to use it with Julia. I might end up trying to switch to Linux entirely (been thinking about it for a while). Anyway, that's a bummer, hopefully these issues can be fixed.

Thanks for the quick answer!

text:
If you're familiar with linux, WSL2 should be very easy to use (almost identical with a few exceptions).

1. With your regular windows computer, go to here and download the binary of your choosing (in this case go for 1.6 linux) <https://julialang.org/downloads/>. Look up a tutorial on how to install binaries.
2.  You can try this in the WSL2 terminal  `sudo apt-get install package=version`  with package being <julia> and version being <1.6> or leave it blank to get the default version

attachments.title: Download Julia
attachments.text: The official website for the Julia Language. Julia is a language that is fast, dynamic, easy to use, and open source. Click here to learn more.
